intro: Chailletia griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan starflower, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant features slender, erect stems that bear clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern and are characterized by their smooth, waxy surface. Chailletia griffithii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters.
